column2: Create a campaign based on the following concepts: {user_prompt}###\n\n

Based on the campaign concept provided below, generate a detailed Table of Contents suitable for an RPG campaign book.
The Table of Contents must strictly follow Homebrewery Markdown formatting.
Use 'PAGENUM' as a placeholder for all page numbers, like '{{PAGENUM}}' and '(#pPAGENUM)'.

The structure should be:

{{{{toc,wide
# Table Of Contents

- ### [{{Main Section Title}}{{PAGENUM}}](#pPAGENUM)
  - #### [{{Subsection Title}}{{PAGENUM}}](#pPAGENUM)
    - [{{Sub-subsection Title (if any)}}{{PAGENUM}}](#pPAGENUM)
  - #### [{{Another Subsection Title}}{{PAGENUM}}](#pPAGENUM)
- ### [{{Another Main Section Title}}{{PAGENUM}}](#pPAGENUM)
  - #### [{{Subsection Title}}{{PAGENUM}}](#pPAGENUM)
  {{!-- If the TOC is long, you can suggest a \column break. e.g. \column --}}

End the Table of Contents with }}}}

Campaign Concept:
{campaign_concept}
Create a few campaign names for a DnD campaign with {}. Use sensory language and hyperbole and metaphor.
-- All of these following are currently unused --

Summarize the following:
---
{}
---
Rewritten as a summary:
